definition: (idiom) everything broken and in disorder
seven/7

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
eight/8
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: I noticed that my mind was all over the place.
sentences.chinese: 我发现自己的心神七零八落，到处都是。

sentences.english: Books were scattered around the room.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里七零八落地放着一些书。

sentences.english: Everybody finished the song at different times.
sentences.chinese: 大家七零八落地唱完了这首校歌。

sentences.english: Carving up our heritage and selling it off to the highest bidder?
sentences.chinese: 把我的遗产拆的七零八落，然后卖给出价最高的买家？

definition: bits and pieces/scattered fragments
scattered and smashed (idiom)
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
smashed up/broken into pieces/thoroughly mashed/pulpy
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
in a terrible mess (idiom)
utterly defeated
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
to crush/to smash/to shatter
to splash across/to splatter
in disorder/messy
